labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is primarily designed for web search, extraction, crawling, and mapping capabilities. It enables AI assistants to perform real-time web searches, extract structured data from web pages, systematically crawl websites, and analyze website structures. The tools provided—tavily-search, tavily-extract, tavily-crawl, and tavily-map—are geared toward data retrieval, content analysis, and research tasks, making it highly specialized for web intelligence and automation.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of the server aligns closely with web search and extraction, making "Web Search & Research" the most appropriate primary label. Secondary labels like "Browser Automation" and "Data Analysis & Processing" are also relevant due to the server's crawling and data extraction capabilities. No custom label was necessary, as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

metadata.server_name: Tavily Web Search and Extraction Server

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Tavily Web Search and Extraction Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Jeetanshu18/tavily-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI assistants to perform real-time web searches, extract data from web pages, map website structures, and crawl websites systematically. Enhance your AI's capabilities with powerful tools for intelligent data retrieval and analysis from the web. Seamlessly integrate advanced search and extraction features into your MCP client workflows.

tools.name: tavily-search
tools.description: Deploy Server Tavily Web Search and Extraction Server @Jeetanshu18/tavily-mcp Try in Playground tavily-search

tools.name: tavily-extract
tools.description: A powerful web content extraction tool that retrieves and processes raw content from specified URLs, ideal for data collection, content analysis, and research tasks.

tools.name: tavily-crawl
tools.description: A powerful web crawler that initiates a structured web crawl starting from a specified base URL. The crawler expands from that point like a tree, following internal links across pages. You can control how deep and wide it goes, and guide it to focus on specific sections of the site.

tools.name: tavily-map
tools.description: A powerful web mapping tool that creates a structured map of website URLs, allowing you to discover and analyze site structure, content organization, and navigation paths. Perfect for site audits, content discovery, and understanding website architecture.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Jeetanshu18/tavily-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: tavilyApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API key for the Tavily MCP server.
